name: Care of Patient with Type II Diabetes
goal: The goal of the Learning Activities in this Program is to provide information on best practices in the nursing care of persons with Type II diabetes to understand the pathophysiology, treatment, and nursing interventions for patients with Type II diabetes.

objectives.objective: Describe the landmarks in diabetes care
Examine type II diabetes guideline updates and their impact on clinical practice
Develop safe and effective care plans for patients with type II diabetes

learning-activities.name: Landmarks in Diabetes:  1995 to 2015
learning-activities.eval: The objective for this learning activity is to be able to describe the landmarks in diabetes care.

review-question.stem: What drug did this article call 'A Game Changer?'

learning-activities.name: Diabetes Mellitus
learning-activities.eval: The objective for this learning activity is to be able to examine type II diabetes guideline updates and their impact on clinical practice.

review-question.stem: What approaches to prevention of diabetic complications did this article mention?

learning-activities.name: Standards of Care
learning-activities.eval: The objective for this learning activity is to be able to examine type II diabetes guideline updates and their impact on clinical practice.

review-question.stem: A pre-meal glucose target is 80-130 mg/dL versus the older target of 70-130 mg/dL.

learning-activities.name: Nutrition in Patients with Diabetes
learning-activities.eval: The objective for this learning activity is to be able develop safe and effective care plans for patients with type II diabetes.

review-question.stem: The “Mediterranean Diet” may be a good option for diabetic patients.

learning-activities.name: Critical Issues in Diabetes: Choosing Newer Drugs for Type 2 Diabetes
learning-activities.eval: The objective for this learning activity is to be able develop safe and effective care plans for patients with type II diabetes.

review-question.stem: DPP-4 Inhibitors may be used with dose modifications in patients with renal disease.

name: Insulin Injection Sites
goal: The goal of the Learning Activities in this Program is to provide information on Insulin Injection Sites.

objectives.objective: Examine diabetes injection site guideline updates and their impact on clinical practice
Develop safe and effective care plans for patients with various Insulin Injection Sites

name: Diabetic Neuropathy
goal: The goal of this activity is to provide information on the pathophysiology, diagnosis, treatment and nursing interventions for patients with diabetic neuropathy.
